radiographic_examinations.findings: Normal sinus rhythm with normal axis and intervals, no evidence of chamber enlargement, and no ST-segment or T-wave abnormalities.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Exercise myocardial perfusion imaging stress test
radiographic_examinations.findings: Moderate-sized, medium-intensity, reversible perfusion defect involving the anterior wall with a left ventricular ejection fraction of 61%
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: ECG reveals 1-mm ST depressions with T-wave inversions in leads V2 through V4; consistent with symptoms and high likelihood of flow-limiting CAD.

radiographic_examinations.findings: 80% stenosis in the left anterior descending coronary artery at the first diagonal, 80% lesion in the left circumflex artery, and a discrete 60% stenosis in the proximal right coronary artery.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Demonstrates progression of coronary artery disease.

radiographic_examinations.findings: 3- to 4-mm ST-segment elevation in leads V1 through V4, with reciprocal ST-segment depression in the inferior leads.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Indicates stent thrombosis and procedure-related ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Anterior hypokinesis and an estimated ejection fraction of 45%.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Demonstrates a decrease in ejection fraction compared to pre-stent data.
